definition: uninspired/dejected/discouraged
mourning garments
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
to crumble/to collapse/to decline/to decay/decadent/dejected/dispirited/balding

sentences.english: In his late years, his poetry of mourning for friends were blurry with waning color.
sentences.chinese: 晚年的悼友詩貴隱括，帶着一層衰頹的色彩。

sentences.english: I do not desire to see it diminished, nor would I endeavor to lessen it in any man.
sentences.chinese: 我並不希望它衰頹，也無意降低任何人的信仰。

sentences.english: Are there more contributing reasons and causes for the current decrepit state of things?
sentences.chinese: 還有其它的理由和原因助長了目前的衰頹狀況嘛？

sentences.english: His chest heaved and his body seemed to droop .
sentences.chinese: 他的胸脯上下起伏，身子也好象衰頹了。

lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
conclusion/judgment/verdict
numerous and confused/in a mess

hard to tell if it's real or sham

with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
